CampaignPosts.postRawText:
diet chart for 12-19 months babies 

morning wake up time 
7:00 to 8:00

breast feed or 1 cup milk

breakfast time 
8:00 to 9:00

sooji (semolina) recipes:-
sooji halwa
sooji upma 

idli with chutney 
dosa with coconut chutney 
banana dosa

paratha :- 
aloo paratha 
paneer paratha cut into small pieces 

bread recipes :-
bread with butter
bread with jam
bread with peanut butter 
french toast 

porridge :-
oats porridge with nuts
multi grain cereal 
makhana kheer

pancakes :-
oats pancake 
apple pancake
banana pancake

# you can also offer a small portion of fruit with breakfast 

# if baby wake up late, then coming early morning milk na breakfast to go at breakfast time

# if baby wakes up early, you may give breakfast earlier too

massage and bath time between 10:00 to 10:30

give baby a nice oil massage and bath with warm water 

sleeping time 10:30 to 11:30

mid morning snacks
11:30 to 12:00

1 small banana cut into peices

1/4 to 1/2 apple cut into peice remove the skin

1/2 cup strawberry peices 

1/2 cup melon peices

1/2 cup chickoo peices

1/2 cup cut grapes 

1 cup any seasonal fruit juice

lunch time 
12:30 to 1:30 

moongdal rice khichdi 

tomato khichdi 

masoor dal spinach khichdi 

barley khichdi 

daliye khichdi 

vegetable khichdi 

toovar dal (arhar dal) rice and carrots

rice with sambhar (less spice) 

dal with roti

vegetable pulav with curd

vegetable pasta with cheese

meethi paratha with curd 

vegetables you can offer varieties of vegetables like potato okra peas spinach cauliflower carrot bottle gourd 

you can also give curd or raita with lunch

sleeping time 
2:00 to 4:00
try to make sure that baby does not sleep later  than 4:00 pm as sleeping late will interfere the sleep time at night

evening snacks 
4:30 to 5:00

1 cup fruit smoothies /milkshakes like banana chickoo strawberry 

1 cup seasonal fruits

1/2 cup oatsmeal with fruits 

1 cup instant kesar almond milk

1/2 cup fruit yogurt

2-3 glucose biscuits with milk

evening park time
5:00 to 6:30

outdoor time is very important and it should be included every day 

take ur baby to park 

encourage ur baby to play with other children play on swing slides etc

sand play is very wonderful sensory activity for young kid and must be encouraged 

dinner time
7:00 to 7:45

vegetable khichdi 

moongdal khichdi 

broken wheat khichdi 

masoor dal spinach khichdi 

barley khichdi 

chapati with paneer curry

roti with peas curry

dosa with aloo masala

vermicelli vegetable upma 

palak paratha with dal or curry

vegetable pasta

points to remember 

you can serve rice and chapati with dal and curry

use the curry that u make for whole family, but take some out for the child before adding spices

serve raw vegetables like cucumber and tomato as salad in lunch and dinner 

offer 2-3 cups of water throughout the day along with solid meals

bed time routine
8:15 to 8:45

after dinner allow baby to relax for about half an hour and then follow the bed time routine 

some children enjoy warm bath before bed time. it relaxes them and help them to sleep 

bed time milk

you can offer your baby a cup of milk before bed time 

or breast feeding before bedtime 

this will keep child full and will help in staying asleep through the night 

tips for bedtime routine 

make sure ur child goes to bed at around same time every day 

some kids still wake up once or twice during the night try to put them back to sleep with some means other than breast feeding as many times it is also for comfort 

at this age child needs not more than 400-500 ml of milk in 24 hours 

limit the milk intake to this so that baby feels hunger for other foods

if you have been giving purees stop them right away. at this age your baby is capable enough to chew her/ his food

don't compare your child with other children. a child usually eats which body needs

try not to get too stressed over the amount being eaten or mess being made. this too shall pass

power diet for 2-5 years schooler

 early-morning(7- 8 am
day 1-1 cup milk with dried fruits and 1 tsp. jaggery/honey
day 2-1 cup milk with almonds and 1 tsp. jaggery/honey
day 3-1 cup milk with dry fruits and 1 tsp. jaggery/honey
day 4-1 cup of banana milk shake with 1 tsp. jaggery /honey
day 5-1 cup of milk with dry fruits and 1 tsp. jaggery/honey
day 6-1 cup of milk with 1 tsp. jaggery/honey
day 7-1 cup of mango milkshake with 1 tsp.
 jaggery/honey 

breakfast(8:30-9:30 am)
day 1-vegetable rava upma: ¬Ω cup, apple: 1 no
day 2- fruit daliya- 1 bowl
day 3-idli: 1 no., coconut chutney: 2 tbsp
 day 4 -fruit pancake- 1 
day 5-veg poha: 1 cup 
day 6-veg dalia- 1 bowl
day 7-oatmeal porridge with fruits & raisins: 1/2 cup 
pmid-morning
(11-11:30 am)
day 1-corn soup: 1/2 cup, banana: 1 no
.day 2-veg. roll: 1, water melon: ¬Ω cup
day 3-orange juice: 1 cup
day 4-mixed veg soup: ¬Ω cup, pineapple: ¬Ω cup
day 5-orange: 1 no.
day 6-papaya: 1 cup, dates: 4-5 nos.
day 7-banana: 1 n
 
lunch(1-2 pm)
day 1-rice: ¬Ω cup, drumstick dal: ¬Ω cup, ghee: 1 tsp, curd: ¬Ω cup
day 2-vegetable pulao: ¬Ω cup, raita: ¬Ω cup
day 3-rice: ¬Ω cup, dal palak: ¬Ω cup, ghee: 1 tsp, curd: ¬Ω cup
day 4-mixed vegetable rice: 1/2 cup, dal fry: 1/2 cup
day 5-rice: ¬Ω cup, bottle gourd dal : ¬Ω cup, ghee: 1 tsp
day 6-chapatti: 1 no., ghee: 1 tsp., carrot and potato vegetable - ¬Ω cup
day 7-rice: ¬Ω cup, green gram dal: ¬Ω cup, ghee: 1 tsp, curd: ¬Ω, cup

 evening snack (4:30- 5:30 pm)
day 1-paneer sandwich: 1 no.
day 2-fresh mango juice: 1 cup
day 3-ragi ladoo = 1 no, banana = 1
day 4-besan ladoo: 1 no. musk melon: ¬Ω cup
day 5-vegetable cutlet: 1 no., lassi: ¬Ω cup
day 6-carrot soup: 1 cup
day 7-fruit salad: 1 cup 

dinner (7:30-8:15)
day 1-potato peas paratha: 1 no., curd: ¬Ω cup
day 2-chapatti : 1 no, ghee: 1 tsp, beetroot vegetable: ¬Ω cup
day 3-vegetable kichadi: ¬Ω cup, curd: 1/2 cup
day 4-vegetable noodles: ¬Ω cup
day 5-paratha: 1 no., dal fry: ¬Ω cup, ghee: 1 tsp
day 6-vegetable pasta: ¬Ω cup
day 7-chapatti: 1 no, panner and peas vegetable: ¬Ω cup, ghee: 1 tsp

 post-dinner (9 pm)
day 1-1 cup milk with 1 tsp. jaggery/honey
day 2-1 cup milk with 1 tsp. jaggery/honey
day 3-1 cup milk with 1 tsp. jaggery/honey
day 4-1 cup milk with 1 tsp. jaggery/honey
day 5-1 cup milk with 1 tsp. jaggery/honey
day 6-1 cup milk with 1 tsp. jaggery/honey
day 7-1 cup milk with 1 tsp. jaggery/honey

note: 
1-food quantity may change according to your kids diet
2-try to avoid packed food as much as you can 
3-use home juice and paneer etc
4-use 100%organic jaggery & honey
5-always sterlize baby utensils
6-you can add juice every day in breakfast

mango desert  ..... 
recipe bahot simple hai . 
aap ek layer mango pulp ka daal do.. uske upar ya to fresh cream dalo ya fir custard dalo ya fir curd dalo.. uske uper maine peda banaya tha usko crush kar ke dala hai. maine sugr add nhi kra qk peda aur mango dono hi meethi hoti hai. fir uspe uper mango chunks dal do. thode der freez me rakh do ya fir na rakho jaise aapko thik lage. ab enjoy karo. 
bahot simple hai aur healthy v weight gaining v.
